definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Feel free to leave your shoelaces untied, you will not fall over.
sentences.chinese: 讓你的鞋帶自由的散開，你也不會因此而跌倒。

sentences.english: Remove ambition and the essential elements of society seem to fly apart .
sentences.chinese: 沒有雄心，組成社會的諸要素就會分散開來。

sentences.english: The heavy clouds are breaking at last!
Our troops fanned out across the fields.
sentences.chinese: 我們部隊在田野裏呈扇形散開。

sentences.english: The crowd started to break up when the night fell.
sentences.chinese: 天快黑時人羣開始散開了。

sentences.english: A long whip stitch or overhand stitch overlying an edge to prevent raveling.
sentences.chinese: 爲了防止散開而包着邊兒縫的一種縫法。

sentences.english: The football fans fanned out across the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 球迷們在球場上成扇形散開。

sentences.english: A curl of black hair fell loosely across his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 他的額頭上垂着一綹散開的黑色捲髮。

sentences.english: He said four camcorders had recorded the ignition process and firework display.
sentences.chinese: 他還提到四個攝像機拍到了煙花散開及起火的過程。

sentences.english: The Ling Ling brings the green wooden clansman to disperse immediately and enter into the city.
sentences.chinese: 林林帶衆綠色木族人頓時分散開來，投入城內。

sentences.english: Everybody, space yourselves out in the room.
sentences.chinese: 請大家在房間裏各自分散開來。

sentences.english: The searchers fanned out to look for the missing child.
sentences.chinese: 搜索的人們爲了尋找失散的小孩，呈扇形散開。

sentences.english: As soon as enemy bomber formation was sighted, the squadron leader gave the order to peel off.
sentences.chinese: 轟炸機羣，中隊長立即命令自己的飛機散開。

sentences.english: A plate of blue smoke hung above the chimney, FIAT in the motionless air.
sentences.chinese: 一縷藍煙懸浮在煙囪上方，在靜止的空氣中散開。

sentences.english: Now, water can flow or it can crash.
sentences.chinese: 然後水可以流動，也可以迸濺散開。

sentences.english: The end of the pier is near, I fear, and the mist hasnt cleared.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕就要到碼頭的盡頭了，可是薄霧還沒有散開。

definition: to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
